command: for s in 13 37 73; do ping -c1 -s "$s" 203.0.113.7 >/dev/null; sleep 0.2; done
explanation: Uses a sequence of ICMP echo requests with specific payload sizes as a covert knock to signal a remote listener to enable a service. No local privileges required to send. Detection: inspect ICMP patterns with unusual, small, sequenced sizes and correlate with service exposure events.
rationale_steps: Select a distinctive sequence of ICMP payload sizes (13, 37, 73).
Emit single pings spaced closely to form a recognizable pattern.
Remote sensor interprets the sequence to unlock a port.
Traffic signaling avoids opening a dedicated control port.
Detection: NIDS rules for ordered ICMP sizes; track post-knock connection success to new services.
